ygData.subject: Re: Damage and General Weapon use
ygData.msgSnippet: Rule of Thumb: --NEVER pay good money for what can be obtained for free, either through hunting mobs/NPC s or at the expense of a player who s poked his
ygData.messageBody:
Rule of Thumb:

--NEVER pay good money for what can be obtained for free, either through
hunting mobs/NPC's or at the expense of a player who's poked his Feir'Dal
nose in where he shouldn't have.;)

Malvolin(Teir'Dal Necromancer who is extremely not happy with the faction
hits)--Rallos Zek

Azalin(Human Shadowknight) <The Arcanum>--Veeshan



-----Original Message-----
From: Xillith ofNeriak <xillith@...>
To: eq_shadowknights@onelist.com <eq_shadowknights@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, June 10, 1999 11:19 AM
Subject: Re: [eq_shadowknights] Damage and General Weapon use


>From: Xillith ofNeriak <xillith@...>
>
>GAWD
>
>Do NOT buy magic weapons. Many creatures drop them. the shiny brass
>Halbred is dropped by the named orc in HH pass, East side. Split Paw
shaman
>drop Rune Totem staves and the named Gnolls in Paw have magical daggers,
>this is a newbee dungeon too.
>
>Dont want to use a dagger? TOUGH. Magic is VERY hard to come by,
>especially the heavy tank weapons. Make due with what you can get. I had
>to become proficient in 2H blunt because I happened across a Rune Totem
>staff when I killed a High Elf in Nectulos at level 9. Immagine the
>confusion when people asked me for cures and I had to explain why an SK is
>using a staff.
>
>Be smart.
>
>
>>From: stuartc@...
>>Reply-To: eq_shadowknights@onelist.com
>>To: eq_shadowknights@onelist.com
>>Subject: [eq_shadowknights] Damage and General Weapon use
>>Date: 7 Jun 1999 15:13:37 -0000
>>
>>From: stuartc@...
>>
>>My main question is how do you calculate damage?
>>My Troll is level 13 with a str of 130, and lets
>>say he's using a weapon that has a damage of 16.
>>How would you calculate the max damage that can be
>>done, or the max damage that weapon can do? Is there
>>a way of doing it?
>>
>>I also am curious what weapon everyone is fighting
>>with? Right now, I have a bronze 2h sword, but
>>I'm looking for sometype of 2h magical weapon so
>>I can start killing wisps and other creatures that
>>only take magical attacks. Should I save my money
>>to get a Shiny Brass halberd(around 150pp) or
>>should I just try to get a fine steel 2h sword
>>and wait to get a magical?
>>
>>-Nuluk(E'ci)
>>
>>------------------------------------------------------------------------
>>Give back to your community through "Grow to Give."
>>http://www.onelist.com
>>Deadline is June 19. See homepage for details.
>>
>
>
